title: Dungeon Heart
description: A game created with Alex Trowers and Leanne Bayley as part of Global Game Jam 2013! The theme was the sound of a heartbeat, so we made a dungeon keeper. In 48 hours. This is why Unity is awesome. This was also my first go at implementing an A* algorithm from scratch in 48 hours!

links.name: Play Game
links.description: Play the game!

title: CSR Racing
description: I worked on the multiplayer update of CSR Racing working on gameplay, UI, build tools and game server code.

links.name: Boss Alien
links.description: A link to the Boss Alien mothership

links.name: CSR Multiplayer Announced
links.description: A Blog post about the game launch!

title: Kinect Sports: Season Two
description: The BAFTA award winning game that I helped ship by implementing the 'Challenge Play' gameplay mode including the user interface and save system for local challenge play.

links.name: Rare's Website
links.description: Rare's Studio Website showing the game!

links.description: A website reviewing KS2's new UI

links.description: A video tutorial showing how Challenge Play works

links.name: Kinect Sports: Season Two BAFTA success
links.description: Rare celebrates the BAFTA award

title: Detour
description: An Indie game developed in XNA and C#. I wrote the entire graphics pipeline, and implemented the runtime graphics code and shader effects.

links.name: Sandswept Studios
links.description: The Sandswept Studios website

title: WikiTime
description: My third year project which places all of the historical events mentioned on Wikipedia on a searchable Timeline interface. The main challenge with the project was processing the whole of Wikipedia so a backend processing system was written to distribute the extraction algorithm over multiple machines and multiple threads.

links.name: WikiTime Project Homepage
links.description: The WikiTime project homepage

title: Trapped
description: A game entered into Ludum Dare 22 which had the theme 'Alone'. Ludum Dare is a 48 hour game development competition. You must escape from a lonely castle. All design, art and code was created by me within 48 hours.

links.name: Play the Game!
links.description: Requires Unity Player to be installed on your browser to run.

title: Space Demo
description: A small graphics demo written in C++ using SDL and OpenGL which shows a collection of procedurally animated spaceships flying around a procedurally generated planet.

links.name: Space Demo Download
links.description: The link containing the Space graphics demo

title: Timeline
description: An app that was thrown together for the Discovery Developer Competition which displays all of the photos from the National Archives via Flickr.

links.name: Timeline
links.description: The entry. Requires Flash Player to run.

links.name: Discovery Developer Competition
links.description: The competition page.

links.description: The UK National Archives Website

links.name: National Archives Flickr
links.description: The National Archives account on Flickr

title: PlayWithYourPeas
description: A game written individually in C++/DirectX using art and design from Danc at lostgarden.com. You must build a map for peas to bounce around allowing them to score happy points!

links.name: Game Installer
links.description: This installer will install the game and any prerequisites automatically!

links.name: Game Source
links.description: The full source code of the game!

title: Fractal
description: A fractal explorer that can draw the Mandelbrot, Julia, Burning Ship and Nova Fractal at realtime rates.

links.name: DirectX Executable
links.description: Requires the latest DirectX Update to be installed.

links.name: XNA Package
links.description: Requires XNA 3.1 Redistributable to be installed.

title: Book Galaxy
description: The winning entry of the JISC MOSAIC Developer Competition. It displays library usage data and library books in a new and interesting way.

links.name: Book Galaxy Page
links.description: The winning entry! Requires Java 6 Runtime to run.

links.name: Developer Competition Page
links.description: The page describing the Developer Competition

links.name: Library Stats made to sparkle
links.description: Who'd have thought library statistics could be so much fun? Alex Parker's free Book Galaxy Applet creates a rivetting search universe out of bog-standard library data

links.name: Source Code
links.description: The source code is available on SourceForge.
